full_text:
#Jets managed to put together a promising rushing attack in 2021 headlined by rookie Michael Carter.

Here is the distribution of rush classifications among all Jets’ RBs this year:

Loss = <0 yds 
Stuff = 0-2 yds
Short = 3-5 yds 
Intermediate = 6-20 yds
Long = 20+ yds
#nflverse https://t.co/gxhry6ZasQ

This graph shows total rushing volume and the breakdown of distance classifications within each #Jets RB.

Carter leads in volume (147 at), but Ty Johnson boasts the greatest % of runs for positive yardage (91.8%), over Carter (89.8%) and Coleman (89.3%).
#nflverse #TakeFlight https://t.co/3P5FzJXOqC
God knows how long it took to figure out how to build a stacked bar graph… #Jets #nflverse @nflfastR https://t.co/KsrM1SWWKr

Death, taxes & Najee Harris getting 20+ touches a game.

Through the 2021 NFL season Harris has touched the ball 381.

Despite this advantage, J. Taylor has been more efficient resulting in 504 more scrimmage yards more than Najee with less touches. 

#nflverse
#RStats https://t.co/nr9dD6Jgtk

The only playoff teams that had an above 0.5 strength of schedule are the Raiders, Steelers, and Chiefs. 
(Niners exactly 0.5)
Data: #nflverse https://t.co/YX552XyD5i

Here are some #nflverse graphs supporting each of the finalists. The bottom-right quadrant is where the Pat Bevs will be.

One note: It's insane that there was a Panthers finalist at each position (Darnold, Hubbard, Anderson). https://t.co/RSPOWByHaW
